intro: Macropteranthes leiocaulis, commonly known as the smooth-leaved macropteranthes, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, smooth leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
